name: Ethiopian Yirgacheffe
description: A bright and floral coffee from Ethiopia’s Yirgacheffe region, known for its tea-like body and notes of jasmine and citrus. Best enjoyed as a pour-over or filter coffee to highlight its delicate flavors.

name: Colombian Supremo
description: A well-balanced South American coffee with caramel sweetness, mild acidity, and nutty undertones. Ideal for espresso and filter brewing, bringing a smooth and rich taste.

name: Sumatran Mandheling
description: An earthy and full-bodied coffee from Indonesia with low acidity and flavors of dark chocolate and spice. Perfect for French press or espresso lovers who enjoy bold, rich coffee.

name: Kenyan AA
description: A vibrant and juicy coffee with intense berry and citrus flavors, high acidity, and a wine-like finish. Best brewed as a pour-over to capture its complex fruity notes.

name: Brazilian Santos
description: A smooth and chocolatey Brazilian coffee with a hint of nuttiness and low acidity. Works exceptionally well for espresso, producing a creamy and well-rounded shot.

name: Arabica Sunrise
description: This coffee is sourced from the lush highlands of Central America. It offers a smooth, nutty flavor with hints of chocolate. Ideal for brewing using French Press or Pour Over methods.

name: Ethiopian Bloom
description: A vibrant coffee from Africa, featuring fruity and floral notes. Perfect for brewing with a Cafetiere or Espresso machine for a rich experience.

name: Colombian Reserve
description: Harvested from South America’s finest plantations, this coffee offers earthy tones with a hint of spice. Best brewed using Filter or Whole Bean methods.

name: Java Bliss
description: This premium coffee from Asia Pacific delivers a bold, chocolatey taste with nutty undertones. Ideal for Espresso or Pour Over brewing.

name: Brazilian Santos
description: A low-acidity coffee with a nutty, chocolatey flavor and a smooth finish. Perfect for espresso and cafetiere brewing methods.

name: Yemen Mocha Matari
description: A rare coffee with deep, winey flavors and a hint of cocoa. Sourced from Yemen, this coffee is excellent for French press or pour-over methods.
